metadata.name: merkle_distributor
metadata.description: A Solana program for distributing tokens according to a Merkle root.

accounts.name: from
docs: Distributor ATA containing the tokens to distribute.

accounts.name: to
docs: Account to send the claimed tokens to.
Claimant must sign the transaction and can only claim on behalf of themself

accounts.name: from
docs: Distributor ATA containing the tokens to distribute.

accounts.name: to
docs: Account to send the claimed tokens to.
Claimant must sign the transaction and can only claim on behalf of themself

accounts.name: token_vault
docs: Token vault to return clawback fee from

accounts.name: to
docs: Account to send the clawed back fee to.

accounts.name: from
docs: Distributor ATA containing the tokens to distribute.

accounts.name: admin
docs: Only Admin can trigger the clawback of funds

accounts.name: payer
docs: Optional payer for the account creation in case it doesn't exist

accounts.name: from
docs: Distributor ATA containing the tokens to distribute.

accounts.name: to
docs: Account to send the claimed tokens to.

instructions.name: new_distributor
docs: This instruction is susceptible to frontrunning that could result in loss of funds if not handled properly.
- A legitimate user opens a new distributor.
- Someone observes the call to this instruction.
- They replace the clawback_receiver, admin, or time parameters with their own.
One situation that could happen here is the attacker replaces the admin and clawback_receiver with their own
and sets the clawback_start_ts with the minimal time allowed. After clawback_start_ts has elapsed,
the attacker can steal all funds from the distributor to their own clawback_receiver account.
- When you call into this instruction, ensure your transaction succeeds.
- To be extra safe, after your transaction succeeds, read back the state of the created MerkleDistributor account and
assert the parameters are what you expect, most importantly the clawback_receiver and admin.
- If your transaction fails, double check the value on-chain matches what you expect.

accounts.name: admin
docs: Admin wallet, responsible for creating the distributor and paying for the transaction.
Also has the authority to set the clawback receiver and change itself.

accounts.name: partner_oracle
docs: Partner Oracle program that stores fees

accounts.name: authority
docs: Wallet authorized to call this method

accounts.name: admin
docs: Only Admin can trigger the clawback of funds

errors.name: Unauthorized
errors.msg: Account is not authorized to execute this instruction

errors.name: OwnerMismatch
errors.msg: Token account owner did not match intended owner

errors.name: SameClawbackReceiver
errors.msg: New and old Clawback receivers are identical

errors.name: ClawbackReceiverIsTokenVault
errors.msg: Clawback receiver can not be the Token Vault

errors.name: SameAdmin
errors.msg: New and old admin are identical

errors.name: StartTimestampAfterEnd
errors.msg: Start Timestamp cannot be after end Timestamp

errors.name: TimestampsNotInFuture
errors.msg: Timestamps cannot be in the past

errors.name: InsufficientFunds
errors.msg: Account does not have enough funds to cover fees

errors.name: ClaimV2Required
errors.msg: This Airdrop must be claimed via claimLockedV2

types.name: ClaimClosedEvent
docs: Emitted when a new claim is created.

types.name: ClaimStatus
docs: Holds whether or not a claimant has claimed tokens.

fields.name: last_amount_per_unlock
docs: Track amount per unlock, can be useful for non-linear vesting

fields.name: distributor
docs: Distributor account for which ClaimStatus was created, useful to filter by in get_program_accounts

fields.name: claims_count
docs: Number of time amount has been claimed

fields.name: closed_ts
docs: Time when claim has been closed

types.name: CompressedClaimStatus
docs: Holds whether or not a claimant has claimed tokens.

types.name: MerkleDistributor
docs: State for the account which distributes tokens.

fields.name: mint
docs: [Mint] of the token to be distributed.

fields.name: max_total_claim
docs: Maximum number of tokens that can ever be claimed from this [MerkleDistributor].

fields.name: unlock_period
docs: Time step (period) in seconds per which the unlock occurs

fields.name: total_amount_claimed
docs: Total amount of tokens that have been claimed.

fields.name: num_nodes_claimed
docs: Number of nodes that have been claimed.

fields.name: clawed_back
docs: Whether or not the distributor has been clawed back

fields.name: claims_closable_by_admin
docs: Whether claims are closable by the admin or not

fields.name: can_update_duration
docs: Whether admin can update vesting duration

fields.name: last_duration_update_ts
docs: Timestamp when update was last called

fields.name: total_claimable_pre_update
docs: Total amount of locked amount claimable as of last duration update, ever increasing total, accumulates with each update

fields.name: clawed_back_ts
docs: Timestamp when funds were clawed back

fields.name: claims_closable_by_claimant
docs: Whether claims are closable by claimant or not

fields.name: claim_min_fee
docs: Dynamic claim fee in SOL, min

fields.name: claim_max_fee
docs: Dynamic claim fee in SOL, max

fields.name: allocation_factor
docs: Factor to multiply claimable SOL lamports by when calculating fee

fields.name: claim_fee_claimed
docs: Whether all claim fees were claimed, true by default since no claim fee is taken on creation

fields.name: token_price_lamports
docs: Last observed token price in lamports per 1 whole token for claim fee calculation

fields.name: clawback_fee_claimed
docs: Whether clawback token % fee has been claimed

fields.name: program_version
docs: Program version that initiated the Distributor account

types.name: NewClaimEvent
docs: Emitted when a new claim is created.
